docs.summary: Contains functionality for refining a data query.

srcDocs.summary: Contains functionality for refining a data query.

params.name: propertyName
params.doc: The properties that will be used in the sort.
params.srcDoc: The properties that will be used in the sort.

ret.doc: A `WixDataQuery` object representing the refined query.
ret.srcDoc: A `WixDataQuery` object representing the refined query.

docs.summary: Adds a sort to a query or sort, sorting by the specified properties in ascending order.
description: The `ascending()` function refines a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataSort` to sort in ascending order of
the specified properties. If you specify more than one property,
`ascending()` sorts the results in ascending order by each property in the
order they are listed.
You can sort the following types:
+ Number: Sorts numerically.
+ Date: Sorts by date and time.
+ String: Sorts alphabetically. The sort is based on the JavaScript sort methodology, which is a lexicographical sort that compares Unicode characters by their code points.
If a property contains a number as a String, that value will be sorted
alphabetically and not numerically. Items that do not have a value for the
specified sort property are ranked lowest.

examples.title: Add an ascending sort to a query
Create a query, add an ascending sort, and run it
Create a query, add an ascending sort, and run it

the specified properties. If you specify more than one property,

You can sort the following types:

+ Date: Sorts by date and time.
+ String: Sorts alphabetically. The sort is based on the JavaScript sort methodology, which is a lexicographical sort that compares Unicode characters by their code points.
If a property contains a number as a String, that value will be sorted
alphabetically and not numerically. Items that do not have a value for the
specified sort property are ranked lowest.

params.doc: The property whose value will be compared with `rangeStart` and `rangeEnd`.

params.doc: The beginning value of the range to match against.

params.doc: The ending value of the range to match against.
params.srcDoc: The ending value of the range to match against.

ret.srcDoc: A `WixDataQuery` object representing the refined query.

docs.summary: Refines a query or filter to match items whose specified property value is within a specified range.
description: The `between()` function refines a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataFilter` to only match items where the value
of the specified property is greater than or equal to `rangeStart` and less
than or equal to `rangeEnd`.
It only matches values of the same type. For example, a number value stored
as a String type does not match the same number stored as a Number type.
If a property contains a number as a String, that value will be compared
alphabetically and not numerically. Items that do not have a value for the
specified property are ranked lowest.
The following types of items can be compared:
+ Number: Compares numerically.
+ Date: Compares JavaScript Date objects.
+ String: Compares alphabetically. The sort is based on the JavaScript sort methodology, which is a lexicographical sort that compares Unicode characters by their code points.

examples.title: Add a between filter to a query
Create a query, add a between filter, and run it
Create a query, add a between filter, and run it

srcDocs.summary: Refines a query or filter to match items whose specified property value is within a specified range.
description: The `between()` function refines a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataFilter` to only match items where the value
of the specified property is greater than or equal to `rangeStart` and less
than or equal to `rangeEnd`.
It only matches values of the same type. For example, a number value stored
as a String type does not match the same number stored as a Number type.
If a property contains a number as a String, that value will be compared
alphabetically and not numerically. Items that do not have a value for the
specified property are ranked lowest.
The following types of items can be compared:
+ Number: Compares numerically.
+ Date: Compares JavaScript Date objects.
+ String: Compares alphabetically. The sort is based on the JavaScript sort methodology, which is a lexicographical sort that compares Unicode characters by their code points.

docs.summary: Refines a query or filter to match items whose specified property value contains a specified string.
description: The `contains()` function refines a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataFilter` to only match items where the value
of the specified property contains the specified `string`.
You can only use `contains()` with a property whose value is a String.

params.name: options
params.doc: An object with one or both of the following boolean properties: suppressAuth, suppressHooks.
params.srcDoc: An object with one or both of the following boolean properties: suppressAuth, suppressHooks.

ret.doc: undefined. on fulfilled - The number of items that match the query.. on rejected - The errors that caused the rejection.
ret.srcDoc: on fulfilled - The number of items that match the query.. on rejected - The errors that caused the rejection.

docs.summary: Returns the number of items that match the query.
description: The `count()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the number of
items that match the query. The Promise is rejected if `count()` is called
with incorrect permissions or if any of the functions used to refine the
query is invalid.
Calling the `count()` function triggers the [`beforeCount()`](wix-data.Hooks.html#beforeCount)
and [`afterCount()`](wix-data.Hooks.html#afterCount) hooks if they have been defined.
Use the `options` parameter to run `count()` without checking for permissions
or without its registered hooks.
Any function that does not filter query results (e.g., [`ascending()`](#ascending))
does not affect the result of `count()`.
If you build a query and don't refine it with any `WixDataQuery` functions,
`count()` returns the total number of items in the collection.
If you have already run a query with [`find()`](#find), you can retrieve
the number of query results without calling `count()`. The [`find()`](#find)
function returns a Promise that resolves to a {@link wix-data.WixDataQueryResult|WixDataQueryResult}
object, which has a `totalCount` property whose value is the number of results.

examples.title: Perform a count on a query
Create a query and perfom a count on it
Create a query and perfom a count on it

srcDocs.summary: Returns the number of items that match the query.
description: The `count()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the number of
items that match the query. The Promise is rejected if `count()` is called
with incorrect permissions or if any of the functions used to refine the
query is invalid.
Calling the `count()` function triggers the [`beforeCount()`](wix-data.Hooks.html#beforeCount)
and [`afterCount()`](wix-data.Hooks.html#afterCount) hooks if they have been defined.
Use the `options` parameter to run `count()` without checking for permissions
or without its registered hooks.
Any function that does not filter query results (e.g., [`ascending()`](#ascending))
does not affect the result of `count()`.
If you build a query and don't refine it with any `WixDataQuery` functions,
`count()` returns the total number of items in the collection.
If you have already run a query with [`find()`](#find), you can retrieve
the number of query results without calling `count()`. The [`find()`](#find)
function returns a Promise that resolves to a {@link wix-data.WixDataQueryResult|WixDataQueryResult}
object, which has a `totalCount` property whose value is the number of results.

docs.summary: Refines a query or filter to match items whose specified property value equals the specified value.
description: The `eq()` function refines a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataFilter` to only
match items where the value of the specified property equals the specified `value`.
It only matches values of the same type. For example, a number value stored
as a String type does not match the same number stored as a Number type.
If the value of the `propertyName` property is an Array, `eq()` includes items
in which any of the elements of the Array match the specified `value`.

Create a query, add an equals filter, and run it
Create a query, add an equals filter, and run it

match items where the value of the specified property equals the specified `value`.
It only matches values of the same type. For example, a number value stored
as a String type does not match the same number stored as a Number type.
If the value of the `propertyName` property is an Array, `eq()` includes items
in which any of the elements of the Array match the specified `value`.

ret.doc: undefined. on fulfilled - A Promise that resolves to the results of the query.. on rejected - Any errors that caused the query to fail, returned as an array.
ret.srcDoc: on fulfilled - A Promise that resolves to the results of the query.. on rejected - Any errors that caused the query to fail, returned as an array.

docs.summary: Returns the items that match the query.
description: The `find()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the results found
by the query and some information about the results. The Promise is
rejected if `find()` is called with incorrect permissions or if any of the
functions used to refine the query is invalid.
Calling the `find()` function triggers the [`beforeQuery()`](wix-data.Hooks.html#beforeQuery)
and [`afterQuery()`](wix-data.Hooks.html#afterQuery) hooks if they have been defined.
Use the `options` parameter to run `find()` without checking for permissions
or without its registered hooks.
If you build a query and don't refine it with any `wixDataQuery` functions,
`find()` returns the entire collection.

examples.title: Perform a find on a query
Create a query and run it
Create a query and run it

docs.summary: Refines a query or filter to match items whose specified property value is greater than or equal to the specified value.
description: The `ge()` function refines a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataFilter` to only
match items where the value of the specified property is greater than or
equal to the specified `value`.
It only matches values of the same type. For example, a number value stored
as a String type does not match the same number stored as a Number type.
If a property contains a number as a String, that value will be compared
alphabetically and not numerically. Items that do not have a value for the
specified property are ranked lowest.
The following types of items can be compared:
+ Number: Compares numerically.
+ Date: Compares JavaScript Date objects.
+ String: Compares alphabetically. The sort is based on the JavaScript sort methodology, which is a lexicographical sort that compares Unicode characters by their code points.

docs.summary: Refines a query or filter to match items whose specified property values equals all of the specified `value` parameters.
description: The `hasAll()` function refines a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataFilter` to
only match items where the value of the specified property equals all of
the specified values.
If the value of the specified property is an array, `hasAll()` will match
if there is a match in the elements of that array for all of the specified
values.
You can specify a list of values to match by providing comma-separated
String, Number, or Date types as the `value` parameters. You can also
specify a list of these values by including them in an array and providing
the array as the `value`.

examples.title: Add a has all filter to a query
Create a query, add a has all filter, and run it
Create a query, add a has all filter, and run it

If the value of the specified property is an array, `hasSome()` will match

the array as the `value`.

params.name: limit
params.doc: The number of items to return, which is also the [`pageSize`](wix-data.WixDataQueryResult.html#pageSize) of the results object.
params.srcDoc: The number of items to return, which is also the [`pageSize`](wix-data.WixDataQueryResult.html#pageSize) of the results object.

ret.doc: A `WixDataQuery` object representing the refined query.
ret.srcDoc: A `WixDataQuery` object representing the refined query.

docs.summary: Limits the number of items the query returns.
description: The `limit` function defines the number of results a query returns in each
page. Only one page of results is retreived at a time. The {@link wix-data.WixDataQueryResult#next|next()}
and {@link wix-data.WixDataQueryResult#prev|prev()} functions are used to
navigate the pages of a query result.
By default, `limit` is set to `50`.
The maximum value that `limit()` can accept is `1000`.

examples.title: Add a limit to a query
Create a query, add a limit, and run it
Create a query, add a limit, and run it

srcDocs.summary: Limits the number of items the query returns.
description: The `limit` function defines the number of results a query returns in each
page. Only one page of results is retreived at a time. The {@link wix-data.WixDataQueryResult#next|next()}
and {@link wix-data.WixDataQueryResult#prev|prev()} functions are used to
navigate the pages of a query result.
By default, `limit` is set to `50`.
The maximum value that `limit()` can accept is `1000`.

examples.title: Add a limit to a query
Create a query, add a limit, and run it

params.name: propertyName

params.srcDoc: The property whose value will be compared with `value`.

ret.doc: A `WixDataQuery` object with the query definition, based on the supplied parameters.
ret.srcDoc: A `WixDataQuery` object with the query definition, based on the supplied parameters.

docs.summary: Refines a query or filter to match items whose specified property value is less than the specified value.
description: The `lt()` function refines a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataFilter` to only match items where the value
of the specified property is less than the specified `value`.
It only matches values of the same type. For example, a number value stored
as a String type does not match the same number stored as a Number type.
If a property contains a number as a String, that value will be compared
alphabetically and not numerically. Items that do not have a value for the
specified property are ranked lowest.
The following types of items can be compared:
+ Number: Compares numerically.
+ Date: Compares JavaScript Date objects.
+ String: Compares alphabetically. The sort is based on the JavaScript sort methodology, which is a lexicographical sort that compares Unicode characters by their code points.

examples.title: Add a less than filter to a query
Create a query, add a less than filter, and run it
Create a query, add a less than filter, and run it

of the specified property is less than the specified `value`.
It only matches values of the same type. For example, a number value stored
as a String type does not match the same number stored as a Number type.
If a property contains a number as a String, that value will be compared
alphabetically and not numerically. Items that do not have a value for the
specified property are ranked lowest.
The following types of items can be compared:
+ Number: Compares numerically.
+ Date: Compares JavaScript Date objects.
+ String: Compares alphabetically. The sort is based on the JavaScript sort methodology, which is a lexicographical sort that compares Unicode characters by their code points.

docs.summary: Refines a query or filter to match items whose specified property value does not equal the specified value.
description: The `ne()` function refines a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataFilter` to only
match items where the value of the specified property does not equal the specified `value`.
It only matches values of the same type. For example, a number value stored
as a String type is considered not equal to the same number stored as a Number type.
If the value of the `propertyName` property is an Array, `ne()` includes items
in which none of the elements of the Array match the specified `value`.

examples.title: Add a not equals filter to a query
Create a query, add a not equals filter, and run it
Create a query, add a not equals filter, and run it

match items where the value of the specified property does not equal the specified `value`.
It only matches values of the same type. For example, a number value stored
as a String type is considered not equal to the same number stored as a Number type.
If the value of the `propertyName` property is an Array, `ne()` includes items
in which none of the elements of the Array match the specified `value`.

params.name: query
params.doc: A query to add to the initial query as a `not` condition.
params.srcDoc: A query to add to the initial query as a `not` condition.

ret.doc: A `WixDataQuery` object representing the refined query.
ret.srcDoc: A `WixDataQuery` object representing the refined query.

docs.summary: Adds a `not` condition to the query or filter.
description: The `not()` function adds a `not` condition to a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataFilter`. A query or filter with a `not`
returns all the items that match the query or filter as defined up to the `not`
function, but don't match the query or filter passed to the `not` function.
If the query or filter only contains a `not()` function, it returns all the items
that don't match the query defined by the `not` method.
The collections referenced by both the initial query and the query passed
to the `not` function must be the same.

examples.title: Add a not to a query
Create a query, add a not, and run it

srcDocs.summary: Adds a `not` condition to the query or filter.
description: The `not()` function adds a `not` condition to a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataFilter`. A query or filter with a `not`
returns all the items that match the query or filter as defined up to the `not`
function, but don't match the query or filter passed to the `not` function.
If the query or filter only contains a `not()` function, it returns all the items
that don't match the query defined by the `not` method.
The collections referenced by both the initial query and the query passed
to the `not` function must be the same.

docs.summary: Adds an `or` condition to the query or filter.
description: The `or()` function adds an inclusive `or` condition to a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataFilter`. A query or filter
with an `or` returns all the items that match the query or filter as defined up to
the `or` function, the items that match the query or filter passed to the `or`
function, and the items that match both.
If the query or filter only contains an `or()` function, it returns all the items in the collection.
The collections referenced by both the initial query and the query passed
to the `or` function must be the same.

examples.title: Add an or to a query
Create a query, add an or, and run it
body: * For example, results contain items where age is:
* But not items where age is:

with an `or` returns all the items that match the query or filter as defined up to
the `or` function, the items that match the query or filter passed to the `or`
function, and the items that match both.
If the query or filter only contains an `or()` function, it returns all the items in the collection.
The collections referenced by both the initial query and the query passed
to the `or` function must be the same.

params.name: skip
params.doc: The number of items to skip in the query results before returning the results.
params.srcDoc: The number of items to skip in the query results before returning the results.

ret.doc: A `WixDataQuery` object representing the refined query.
ret.srcDoc: A `WixDataQuery` object representing the refined query.

docs.summary: Sets the number of items to skip before returning query results.
description: The `skip()` function defines the number of results to skip in the query
results before returning new query results.
For example, if you query a collection and 50 items match your query, but
you set `skip` to 10, the results returned will skip the first 10 items
that match and return the 11th through 50th items.
By default, `skip` is set to 0.

examples.title: Add a skip to a query
Create a query, add a skip, and run it
Create a query, add a skip, and run it

srcDocs.summary: Sets the number of items to skip before returning query results.
description: The `skip()` function defines the number of results to skip in the query
results before returning new query results.
For example, if you query a collection and 50 items match your query, but
you set `skip` to 10, the results returned will skip the first 10 items
that match and return the 11th through 50th items.
By default, `skip` is set to 0.

docs.summary: Refines a query or filter to match items whose specified property value starts with a specified string.
description: The `startsWith()` function refines a `WixDataQuery` or `WixDataFilter` to only match items where the value
of the specified property starts with the defined `string`.
You can only use `startsWith()` with a property whose value is a String.
